body: @ebarboni It's on you whether to include this one into 11.3-beta2

Well, the catch is from @JaroslavTulach

Hi! As NetBeans user where should I add some custom php stubs for code autocompletion?
Some time ago (pretty long) I used to just place those files at path like `... / phpstubs / phpruntime`, how should I action now?

@VBelozyorov 
1. Unzip `php/docs/phpsigfiles.zip`
2. Edit/Create files
3. Zip them as `phpsigfiles.zip` again

BTW, If you have questions, please ask about them via the mailing list :) https://netbeans.apache.org/community/mailing-lists.html

Thanks.
@tmysik Thank you!
@junichi11 You are welcome, of course! :)

> We are late in the cycle (i.e. release preparation is already happening). I'd like to see this going in early in the 12.0 cycle.

Hi, @neilcsmith-net and @matthiasblaesing. I'm not sure of the status for this PR, is this mergeable ? need feedback or still work in progress ?
@ebarboni personally don't know - although looks like @lkishalmi has tested and recommends merging?  Good to get in in principle - it's affecting me on a project at the moment!

I've only checked this PR at the early stage, looked good and in fact it is not being merged blocks a few of my outstanding fixes for Gradle vs JavaFx documentation. I'm kind of +0 merging it at this phase of the release.
I see JavaFx is getting popular again with NetBeans, and if we add a bit of emphasis testing the javadoc functionality, I think we can eventually merge this into 11.3beta2

I didn't do a code review, but I did test the fix and document the results rather thoroughly two timeson [Nov 7, 2019](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1548#issuecomment-551237510) and again on [Nov 21, 2019](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1548#issuecomment-557233309). Based on the test results, I recommended that it be merged at the time.

It's easy to follow along and repeat my tests, if anyone wants to test it on the latest NetBeans. I also created a [repository comparing NetBeans](https://github.com/jgneff/netbeans-doc-src/tree/master/netbeans-intellij) with the competition on this feature. NetBeans wins the comparison, in my opinion, but only if these bugs can get out of the way.

So for me, the sooner this is merged, the better! That will make it one down, [ten more to go](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-3296).
going to merge.
@matthiasblaesing can we move to 12.0 ?
well not for 11.3 I guess.
@arusinha it's a bit complicated for me. if @jlahoda can review fast and is ok I will merge.
@ebarboni yes - I have removed the milestone, as said in the review for me having this on the EDT sounds dangerous, so this is work in progress.

Thank you for merging! I got a new job and didn't have much time to dedicate to this. I might come back to it when time permits, there are still some improvements / fixes left for full JavaFX support with Maven.

Cannot find class [org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.ControllerClassNameHandlerMapping

I am afraid the replacement of StringBufferInputStream with StringReader does not look quite right - the API client asked for an InputStream, so we should not return them a Reader (they could ask for a Reader if that is what they need). Not completely sure what is the best replacement, but new ByteArrayInputStream(html.getBytes()) might be sensible (will use the platform's encoding, which feels like a sensible/defendable thing to do). There might be some compatibility impact, but probably very small/negligible.

Fixing that is for another time.

@pedro-w looking at the diff, it seems that lot of UI default values are now obsolete (e.g. `nb.heapview.border1`).

These are defined in at least 3 files:
https://github.com/apache/netbeans/search?q=%22nb.heapview.border1%22&unscoped_q=%22nb.heapview.border1%22

Would be good to remove obsolete values there too.
@DevCharly I can do that. Will it cause problems if something tries to set those values after they are removed? (e.g. a look and feel, I am not sure how they interact)

> Will it cause problems if something tries to set those values after they are removed?

No.

Strange that the background color in the FlatLaf Dark screenshot above is `#C0BCAC` (the default in class `HeapView`) because it is defined as `#4e4e4e` in `FlatDarkLaf.properties`:

https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/7aec6ca83c5b71b8ef1d6c9cb8a43e3508a5d1dc/platform/o.n.swing.laf.flatlaf/src/org/netbeans/swing/laf/flatlaf/FlatDarkLaf.properties#L107

Does it really work? I'm assuming this is for Ant projects. AFAIK the list of jar-s is provided instead of the bom, however if the bom is working, then probably we shall not set the list of jars.

maven and ant NetBeans created web application cannot be run with 5.x. (bad conf file)

> Also it looks sharper on my PC than the image above, something to do with scaling a PNG?

Yes, if you're viewing PNGs in Chrome on, say, 150% HiDPI scaling, you need to have a 67% zoom level to ensure each pixel in the PNG is shown as a device pixel on your monitor. (On MacOS, retina scaling is always 200%, so 50% zoom is what would achieve this, I believe.)
@ebarboni  request you to consider this fix in 11.3 , without which Single Source File debug will not work in Windows.

@lkishalmi any way to only run this on first launch, or offer the option to mute rather than remove?  This is rapidly becoming my least favourite feature of beta2.  cc/ @geertjanw

Would indeed be an idea to have it disabled by default and require a setting in netbeans.conf and/or Options window to enable it. The feature itself is very useful but also potentially very noisy in its current default state.

> hi @singh-akhilesh, would be perfect to rebase on your side. Will merge after

Rebase done

@geertjanw I agree with the idea of having it enabled by default, because for many users that's right (at least once), but there really needs to be a way to tell it to shut up - I get what you were complaining about at FOSDEM now! :smile:

@lkishalmi or maybe we use similar logic as https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/platform/uihandler/src/org/netbeans/modules/uihandler/Installer.java#L331 to only run this on _second_ run of IDE?  I assume there's no chance of overlap with import upgrade task with this - ie. removing a userdir in process of being imported?
